Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の人
Entry.EnglishText: Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: 祭司
Entry.EnglishText: Priest

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の人
Entry.EnglishText: Man

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: ダナ
Entry.EnglishText: Dana

Entry.JapaneseText: オックス
Entry.EnglishText: Ochs

Entry.JapaneseText: <Agarte>
Entry.EnglishText: <Agarte>

Entry.JapaneseText: おじいさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Man

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd

Entry.JapaneseText: 装備品屋・道具屋
Entry.EnglishText: Weapon Shop - Item Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋・食材屋
Entry.EnglishText: Inn - Grocery Store

Entry.JapaneseText: しばらくリフトに 乗れそうもありませんね。
Entry.EnglishText: It appears we won't be using the lift anytime soon.

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード港からなら 本当に首都バルカへ 侵入する事ができるのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Can we really sneak into Balka from Babilograd's port?

Entry.JapaneseText: 間違いないだろう。 サニイタウンで聞いたとおりなら、 他の街の港は全て封鎖されている。
Entry.EnglishText: Of course. If what we heard in Sunnytown is true, all of the other ports across the entire kingdom have been blockaded.

Entry.JapaneseText: 物資の流通も含めて、 首都に一番近いこの港が バルカへと唯一通じる港に なっているはずだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Considering that goods still need to be shipped and that Babilograd's harbor is the closest to Balka, it would make sense that this one is the only one still in operation.

Entry.JapaneseText: じゃあ、<Blue>王の盾<White>にさらわれた 女の人たちも、ここの港から バルカに送られてるってコト？
Entry.EnglishText: So then, would that mean the girls kidnapped by the <Blue>Royal Shield<White> are being transported to Balka from here?

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、港の近くには大勢の人を 収容できるような広い建物はないし、 リフトでは一度に運びきれないだろうし、 手間がかかりすぎると思わない？
Entry.EnglishText: But there doesn't appear to be any buildings near the port large enough to accommodate so many people. And wouldn't having to use the lift repeatedly would be time-consuming?

Entry.JapaneseText: うーん……
Entry.EnglishText: Hmm...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……すみません。
Entry.EnglishText: ...I apologize.

Entry.JapaneseText: いや。
Entry.EnglishText: It's fine.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……早く行け……
Entry.EnglishText: ...We must hurry.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……急げ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Hurry.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……すみません。
Entry.EnglishText: ...I apologize.

Entry.JapaneseText: 今のナニ……？
Entry.EnglishText: What was that about?

Entry.JapaneseText: 服装からすると 聖殿の祭司のようだったな。
Entry.EnglishText: Judging from his clothing, he was likely a priest from the holy temple.

Entry.JapaneseText: リフトの方へ行ったみたいだけど、 使えるようになったのかな？
Entry.EnglishText: They were heading toward the lift. Do you think it's up and running now?

Entry.JapaneseText: 見に行こう。
Entry.EnglishText: Let's find out.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……以前お会いしましたよね？ ちょうどよかった。 お聞きしたい事が……
Entry.EnglishText: Haven't we met before? What perfect timing. There's something we'd like to ask you.

Entry.JapaneseText: むかし、東大陸の北方に、 ハーフが暮らす街があったと 聞きました。
Entry.EnglishText: We heard that long ago, in the northernmost part of the eastern continent, there was a village in which Halfs dwelled.

Entry.JapaneseText: 皆さん……旅の途中で 何かお聞きになった事は ありませんか？
Entry.EnglishText: Have you heard of such a place during your travels?

Entry.JapaneseText: なぜ、そんな事を 知りたいんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: Why would you want to know about something like that?

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律に、種族の対立…… この街に、僕たちの居場所は もうありません……
Entry.EnglishText: Between our religion's commandments and the racial antagonism... We just can't live here anymore.

Entry.JapaneseText: そこなら、私たちのような二人でも 居場所を見つけられると……
Entry.EnglishText: We were thinking that we need to find somewhere that would be welcoming of a couple like us...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……冗談じゃない！
Entry.EnglishText: You've got to be kidding me!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとヒューマが 愛し合うなんて……私は認めない。 絶対に許さない……
Entry.EnglishText: A Gajuma and a Huma, falling in love? I can't approve of such a thing. Completely unacceptable.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>さん……？
Entry.EnglishText: Hilda...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 行くわよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm leaving.

Entry.JapaneseText: オックス!!
Entry.EnglishText: Ochs!

Entry.JapaneseText: ダナ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Dana!

Entry.JapaneseText: よかった…… あなたが無事で、 本当に良かった……
Entry.EnglishText: Thank goodness... I'm so glad you're safe!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……まだ、この街を 出て行くつもり？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you still plan on leaving this city?

Entry.JapaneseText: えっ……
Entry.EnglishText: Huh?

Entry.JapaneseText: つらい事かもしれないけど、 できる事なら、あなたたちには ずっとこの街にいて欲しいの……
Entry.EnglishText: I know it might be hard for you, but if you can, I think you should stay here for as long as possible.

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたたちは間違ってない。 堂々と胸を張っていて欲しい。
Entry.EnglishText: I want you to hold your heads up high, because you have nothing to be ashamed of.

Entry.JapaneseText: それは、あなたたちと 同じような境遇を持つ 人々の希望になるから……
Entry.EnglishText: If you can do that, then you can serve as a beacon of hope to others who find themselves in similar circumstances.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……私の両親の姿が、 私の希望になったように……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Just like how my parents gave me hope...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>さん……あなた……！
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>, you...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……わかりました。 私たちがんばります。
Entry.EnglishText: I understand. We'll make it through this!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ありがとう。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Thank you.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……街の雰囲気も 柔らかくなったネ。
Entry.EnglishText: It looks like things have calmed down, huh?

Entry.JapaneseText: 次の街へ行こうぜ!!
Entry.EnglishText: On to the next city!

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、<Veigue>…… 私、お父さんとお母さんに 会いたくなっちゃった……
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, <Veigue>? I want to go see Mom and Dad...

Entry.JapaneseText: クレア……
Entry.EnglishText: Claire...

Entry.JapaneseText: この姿を見てもお父さんたちなら、 きっとわかってくれる……
Entry.EnglishText: Even if they see me like this, I'm sure they'd understand...

Entry.JapaneseText: 元に戻れなくっても…… だから……
Entry.EnglishText: Even if I...can't go back to the way I was...

Entry.JapaneseText: クレア…… オレが必ずアガーテを見つけて、 おまえを元に戻してみせる。
Entry.EnglishText: Claire... I promise you, I'll find Agarte and get you back to normal.

Entry.JapaneseText: 元に戻ったら……帰ろう。
Entry.EnglishText: After we do that, then we can go home.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>……
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>...

Entry.JapaneseText: みんなが待っているぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Everyone's waiting for us.

Entry.JapaneseText: くっ……まさか……
Entry.EnglishText: Gh...Oh no...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律か……
Entry.EnglishText: Commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか……戒律のせいで しゃべれないんだったネ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh right... Can't speak because of the commandments.

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、男とは 話せないようだな……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems that you can't talk to men because of the commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律……ですね。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, the Commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっか、戒律が あったんだったな……
Entry.EnglishText: Man... So we really can't talk because of the Commandments...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律のせいで、女と 話せないんだったわね……
Entry.EnglishText: Because of the commandments, you aren't allowed to talk to women...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの娘を連れた軍隊？ 知らん、知らん！
Entry.EnglishText: Military troops who capture girls, you say!? Never heard of them!

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシはお祈りに忙しいんだ、 邪魔をするな！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm busy praying! Go bother someone else!

Entry.JapaneseText: おまえさん、ヒューマなどと そぞろ歩きおって……
Entry.EnglishText: To be on a stroll with those... Huma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマにあるまじき行動だと 思わんのか!?
Entry.EnglishText: Have you no shame as a Gajuma!?

Entry.JapaneseText: ふん、あっち行け！ イヤだと言うなら、 力ずくででもどかしてやる!!
Entry.EnglishText: Hmph! Go somewhere else lest you force my hand!

Entry.JapaneseText: こうして、街に戻れたのは 蒼獣様のお陰じゃ……！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm finally back thanks to the Azure Beast's mercy...!

Entry.JapaneseText: やっぱり蒼獣様は 我らガジュマの味方じゃった!!
Entry.EnglishText: Truly he is an ally to us Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマどもめ、この恨み…… 晴らさずにはおけんぞ……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma fools, I will not let this trespass remain absolved...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマと仲良くするべきだと 言い出すバカ者が増えとるが、 ワシはそんなの認めんぞ……！
Entry.EnglishText: Fools saying that we Gajuma should start getting along with Huma have started to appear, but I refuse to acknowledge them!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマめ、気安くワシに 声をかけるんじゃない！
Entry.EnglishText: Damn Huma! Do not call out to me so amiable!

Entry.JapaneseText: こんな音……ヒューマの うるさい声に比べたら 静かなもんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: This sound... Compared to Huma voices, this is quite peaceful!

Entry.JapaneseText: 散々、ヒューマにケチをつけ、 文句ばかり言っとったワシに、 ヒューマが……ヒューマが……
Entry.EnglishText: I've always thoroughly expressed my hate towards Huma... Yet they've...

Entry.JapaneseText: 優しい言葉をかけて……くれた。 ワシは……ワシは…… どうしていいのかわからん……
Entry.EnglishText: Always been so kind to me... I... I don't know how to... respond...

Entry.JapaneseText: 邪魔だと？ 何を言いおるか！
Entry.EnglishText: A nuisance!? What on earth are you talking about!?

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシはこうして毎朝毎晩 蒼獣様にお祈りを捧げておるのじゃ！
Entry.EnglishText: I've been here, praying to the Azure Beast day in, day out!

Entry.JapaneseText: おまえの方が邪魔じゃー！ アッチ行けー！
Entry.EnglishText: You're more of a nuisance than I am! Leave!

Entry.JapaneseText: 家族以外の異性と話せないのは 面倒くさくないかって？
Entry.EnglishText: You know, sometimes I can't help but think, that...

Entry.JapaneseText: 時々思うけど、生まれた時から ずっとそうだったし…… 特に不自由はないわね。
Entry.EnglishText: ...the commandments of not
Entry.Notes: something seems wrong with the translation

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマとガジュマって 別の生き物だと思うのよね……
Entry.EnglishText: I do think that Huma and Gajuma really are different creatures...

Entry.JapaneseText: 見た目が全然違うし…… よく見ると気持ち悪いのよね……
Entry.EnglishText: They both look different, and looking at Gajuma pisses me off...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマなんて、 この街にはいらないの!! ヒューマこそ選ばれた種族よ！
Entry.EnglishText: There's no place for Gajuma in this city! We Huma are the chosen race!

Entry.JapaneseText: 蒼の聖殿を守る仕事は ヒューマのもの。 もともとガジュマなんて、 この街にいらなかったのよ！
Entry.EnglishText: It's OUR job to protect the Sanctuary in the first place. This city has never needed Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: ごめんなさい…… あなたたちガジュマに ひどい仕打ちした事……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm sorry... I've treated you Gajuma so poorly...

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたたちみたいに ガジュマと仲良くする必要が…… あるのかもね……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems that I have to get along with Gajuma like you do...

Entry.JapaneseText: 私、ガジュマの姿が 気持ち悪いなんて思ったり してたんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: Sometimes, I thought that Gajuma looked revolting, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: 自分と違うからって、 そんな風に思っちゃダメよね。
Entry.EnglishText: Just because you're different than me doesn't mean that I have the right to think that.

Entry.JapaneseText: 違う事を認めた上で、 お互いの価値観を知るように 努力しなくちゃね……
Entry.EnglishText: I've recognized what I've done wrong, and I'll put effort into understanding each other's worth from now on.

Entry.JapaneseText: 時々、山鳴りが聞こえる事が あるけど……これは違うわね。 なんだか不気味……
みんなで協力して、 この変な状況を乗り越えなきゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: With everyone's cooperation, we'll overcome this strange situation...

Entry.JapaneseText: 戒律？ 私は守ってるわよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Commandments? I'll uphold them.

Entry.JapaneseText: だって…… バチが当たったら 痛いじゃない？
Entry.EnglishText: Wouldn't it hurt if you were to receive divine punishment?

Entry.JapaneseText: え？ そういう問題じゃない？
Entry.EnglishText: Huh? Was that the case?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No
